reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The pearl hotel is certainly a gem of a hotel as everything went according to my expectations during my stay at this hotel. Comfortable beds, excellent environment, professional staff, better services and facilities were available and the best part is that its location is ideal. Times Square isn’t too far away from the hotel. The size of the room was quite large and so as the King sized bed. The breakfast was very good and I can’t forget to mention that wine and cheese hour. Oh, Yummy and delicious. Well, I’m really pleased with the hotel services. The elegance and decorative prospects of the rooms were simply superb. Similarly, the moderate lighting and excellent fixtures within the rooms were great. The most important aspect that I’d like to include is that its affordability. Getting a room in the core of NYC might be expensive though when it comes to the pearl hotel then one doesn’t have to be worried about it. The prices are fairly good enough for a better stay in NYC. So, this hotel is certainly recommended from my side.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel in NYC, Just Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous location. Right across the street from Book of Mormon, next door to Chicago. Other shows just a short walk. Visit Lillies a few doors down, great food and old NYC atmosphere. Seraphina's across the street has a great breakfast with the best orange juice.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and decorated very contemporary. Breakfast is very basic continental, but it's included so that's nice. Never made it to the wine tasting, but nice touch. My only complaint is that the lighting in the bathroom sucks ladies, BUT...I've have yet to stay in a hotel (even the Ritz) that has good lighting in the bathroom. Staff was nice. Bed was very comfy, noise was minimal. Overall it was a great stay. I recommend it and would stay again!
reviews.title: Highly recomended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed here for 4 days in Nov and everything was amazing. We were upgraded to a king suite without even asking when they found out it was our aniversary. The continental breakfast had a great selection of items and at 4-5pm everyday there is a happy hr (free) with wine and cheese. The room was large, modern and spotless. Times Square is a 3 min walk. All the employes were very friendly and helpful. I would return here without a doubt.
reviews.title: Will definitely return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: We just came back from a girl's weekend in New York and were SO pleased with The Pearl. The amenities are outstanding (continental breakfast, wine hour, free wi-fi) and the staff was helpful and friendly. In addition, the location was great and close to many nice restaurants.
reviews.title: Great location. Very nice boutique hotel.
Christmas trip!
reviews.text: Our first stay at The Pearl and we loved it. The shower was great with a rain showerhead. Philosophy travel items in the room. Clean, clean, clean. Felt completely safe with the children. Great location. We were right next to Times Square and the location was perfect! The hotel staff was very pleasant. The breakfast saved us at least $40/day. We ate breakfast out one morning at Caffe Benno just because my husband was dying to try the waffles. They were very good, and loved the atmosphere. The hotel bellhops and desk always helpful. There were snacks and water always out which was nice traveling with children. The room with two queens was plenty big for a family of four. We never heard any noise except the occasional siren. Only 8 rooms on our floor total. I loved that it was a somewhat smaller hotel. Microwave and fridge also a plus. Went to the Food Emporium twice to pick up dinner when we were just tired of fighting the crowd. St. Malachy's church next door was beautiful and a nice place to stop in and give thanks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are traveling to NYC for theatre performances, this hotel is in a fabulous location. Also, it's an easy walk to Rockefeller Center, and Radio City Music Hall. Room 709 was very clean and spacious. The service provided by Christian, our concierge, was above and beyond the call of duty each time we asked for assistance. Also, we received excellent pre-trip planning service from Ozzie at the front desk and Christian in arranging transportation from the airport. Our trip was a special birthday celebration during the busy holiday season, and the staff made it a memorable experience. The staff was very well-trained in putting the customer first, and their attitude was consistent from the moment we entered the front door. The free wifi service worked with no glitches. We would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location and Friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pearl Hotel in Manhattan is fabulous value for the money. Large very clean rooms which are extremely well appointed. Comfortable beds, good service with a friendly professional staff. We were literally one block from Times square, walking distance to all broadway shows and Hells Kitchen (for great restaurants) was just a couple of blocks. Complimentary continental breakfast was also a bonus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here for a few days in November on the tail end of a business trip. The room was really large (especially for Manhattan) and beautifully presented. Bed was extremely comfortable (and I long to get one for home. Bathroom was small, but nicely fitted out. The free breakfast was fairly limited (but there are plenty of other places to get breakfast in Manhattan). Bene across the street did fairly good coffee.

Someone is stuffing the ballot box for The Pearl!
reviews.text: I booked The Pearl for a weekend stay based on TripAdvisor reviews. Having stayed there this past weekend, I have to share a suspicion:

reviews.title: Amazing find...
reviews.text: I think someone has been stuffing the ballot box in favor of The Pearl. The Pearl doesn't deserve the glowing reviews that it has received -- and I suspect that they are bogus reviews aimed at pumping up this ridiculous property.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hip Place
reviews.text: The Pearl is not a boutique hotel -- it is a renovated MOTEL. It's basically a dozen rooms circling a tiny pool. The management has tried to doll the place up, but the upgrades are very meager. My room felt like a cleaned up basement. The "platform King bed" looked as though it were resting on packing pallets! The entire place screams "motel".
